static cumulative_distribution(cut_line, particle_position_df)[source]¶
particle_distribution(cut_line, time, particle_position_df, drop_returns='False')[source]¶
The question this method answers are two:
  1. CUMULATIVE
    what is the TOTAL number of particles that passed by the slice at L for every time period. Note: the output is cumulative. meaning that at time t_n the particle count includes all those before t_n-1 and
  2. DISCRETE
    How many particles pass at different times from the slice L.
Parameters:
  • cut_line – float
  • time – array
  • particle_position_df –
  • drop_returns – bool
Returns:

dataframe
drop_returns:
if True:
This simply means to drop the particles that dispersed backwards at any point in time to avoid a negative y axis in the discrete distribution curve.
